intro: Calycobolus breviflorus, commonly known as the short-flower calycobolus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface and a distinctive violet hue. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Due to its limited geographic distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
